intro: Palicourea chimo, commonly known as Chimo's evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory flora in tropical rainforests.
